Detailed Description

Retrieve overall information about the space on a filesystem.

The following example demonstrates how to use this FileStatus class.

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {

     // new Content instance
     gaia::core::Context* context =  new gaia::core::Context(this);

     gaia::storage::File* file = context->getCacheDirN();
     // New a FileStatus by the /cache directory.
     gaia::storage::FileStatus* fileStatus = new gaia::storage::FileStatus(*file);

     int32_t blockSize = fileStatus->getBlockSize();
     int32_t availableBlocks = fileStatus->getAvailableBlocks();

     int64_t availableSize = availableBlocks * blockSize;
     LOGI("Internal Memory of /cache is %Ld", availableSize);
 }

See the sample given above. It computes the free spaces of /cache directory.

Definition at line 42 of file FileStatus.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::storage::FileStatus::FileStatus ( const File &  file) [explicit]

Construct a new FileStatus for looking at the stats of the filesystem at file.

Upon construction, the stat of the file system will be performed, and the values retrieved available from the methods on this class.

Parameters:
fileA file in the desired file system to state.
gaia::storage::FileStatus::FileStatus ( const base::String &  path) [explicit]

Construct a new FileStatus for looking at the stats of the filesystem at path.

Upon construction, the stat of the file system will be performed, and the values retrieved available from the methods on this class.

Parameters:
pathA path in the desired file system to state.

Member Function Documentation

int32_t gaia::storage::FileStatus::getAvailableBlocks ( )

The number of blocks that are free on the file system and available to applications.

This corresponds to the Unix statfs.f_bavail field.

int32_t gaia::storage::FileStatus::getBlockCount ( )

The total number of blocks on the file system.

This corresponds to the Unix statfs.f_blocks field.

int32_t gaia::storage::FileStatus::getBlockSize ( )

The size, in bytes, of a block on the file system.

This corresponds to the Unix statfs.f_bsize field.

int32_t gaia::storage::FileStatus::getFreeBlocks ( )

The total number of blocks that are free on the file system, including reserved blocks (that are not available to normal applications).

This corresponds to the Unix statfs.f_bfree field. Most applications will want to use getAvailableBlocks() instead.

FileStatus& gaia::storage::FileStatus::operator= ( const FileStatus &  o) [private]
void gaia::storage::FileStatus::restat ( const base::String &  path)

Perform a restat of the file system referenced by this object.

This is the same as re-constructing the object with the same file system path, and the new stat values are available upon return.

Parameters:
pathA path in the desired file system to state.
